alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:09PM AKST until December 15 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THURSDAY TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Northeast winds gusting as high as 40 mph will reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Mekoryuk. * WHEN...From 9 PM Thursday to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will lead to white out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...On Thursday afternoon, strong northeasterly winds will begin to increase over the Kuskokwim Delta coast. Snow will begin Thursday evening along the coast and then spread inland through Friday. For areas further inland such as Bethel, northeast winds gusting up to 30 mph may reduce visibility to one half mile at times.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
